**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 309 2.0 Gifts are divided up into three tiers. Minor gifts grant useful, often scaling abilities and are available early in a character's career. Major gifts define a relic, determining its true purpose and granting powerful abilities. Grand gifts are the pinnacle of power, and most relics never have more than one. The more gifts there are of one aspect, the more the relic reflects that aspect, and the more influence the aspect has on the character who wields it. An item with multiple shadow gifts might begin to lose its color. With four or five, the character that wields it might take on an ashen tone and the relic might become entirely made of shadow.
Runes as Gifts You can substitute runes for gifts. If you choose to allow property runes on the relic, you'll want them to take up rune slots. Otherwise, you can give as many or few as you prefer, just like any other gifts. Runes are sorted into minor, major, and grand categories, but you should use their normal level and Price when you adjust treasure, instead of the number and levels on the Relic Gifts table. If you're using the player-driven relics variant, it's recommended you do not include this option. **Weapon** (Minor) [shifting](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2846) Fiend**Armor** (Minor) energy-resistant or greater energy resistant (acid, cold, or fire)

**Weapon** (Minor) [flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2838); **Weapon** (Major) greater flaming Life**Weapon** (Minor) [vitalizing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2852); **Weapon** (Major) greater vitalizing Mind**Armor** (Minor) [raiment](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2791); **Armor** (Major) invisibility Plant**Weapon** (Minor) shifting Shadow**Armor** (Minor) [shadow](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2793); **Armor** (Major) greater shadow;
